6e1e876c-a1a2-4d61-9e91-a7b94bdd33d9.description: Earners of the Understanding Space badge have a fundamental understanding of astronautics and space systems engineering. After completing this introductory course, earners can define important astronautics terms and concepts, comprehend space mission capabilities and limitations, and apply space concepts to real-world problems. They are also able to analyze typical space problems, synthesize concepts to design a space mission and evaluate basic technical and programmatic space issues.
6e1e876c-a1a2-4d61-9e91-a7b94bdd33d9.name: Understanding Space (SSC)

issuer.summary: issued by Teaching Science and Technology, Inc.

badge_template_activities.title: Successfully complete Understanding Space course for a total of 20 contact hours.
Pass corresponding Understanding Space exam.

90854c05-025c-42d2-92fb-eec8a68cebc4.description: After completing the Aerospace Science: the Exploration of Space introductory course, earners have a fundamental understanding of astronautics, spaceflight, space vehicles, launch systems, and space operations. They can define important astronautics terms and concepts, comprehend space mission capabilities and limitations, and apply space concepts to real-world problems.
90854c05-025c-42d2-92fb-eec8a68cebc4.name: Aerospace Science (SSC)

issuer.summary: issued by Teaching Science and Technology, Inc.

badge_template_activities.title: Successfully complete our Aerospace Science course for a total of 20 contact hours.
Pass corresponding Aerospace Science exam.

4f53c0aa-3dfe-4615-b536-263ec073edc5.description: Earners of the Certified Space Professional badge have a fundamental understanding of astronautics and space systems engineering. After completing this introductory course, earners can define important astronautics terms and concepts, comprehend space mission capabilities and limitations, and apply space concepts to real-world problems. They are also able to analyze typical space problems, synthesize concepts to design a space mission and evaluate basic technical and programmatic space issues.
4f53c0aa-3dfe-4615-b536-263ec073edc5.name: Certified Space Professional

issuer.summary: issued by Teaching Science and Technology, Inc.

badge_template_activities.title: Successfully complete two-day Understanding Space course.
Pass corresponding Understanding Space exam.

34ae5140-4ed5-432e-aacf-418e2fec2396.description: Earners have completed the 5-day, 26-hour Designing Space Missions & Systems workshop which examines the real-world application of the entire space systems operations and engineering discipline. They have the knowledge, tools and experience to start with a blank sheet of paper and design an effective space mission to meet a broad set of objectives, or critically analyze proposed mission designs with insight into the critical trade-offs between cost, schedule, performance and risk.
34ae5140-4ed5-432e-aacf-418e2fec2396.name: Designing Space Missions & Systems

issuer.summary: issued by Teaching Science and Technology, Inc.

badge_template_activities.title: Successfully completed 26 contact hours of coursework in Designing Space Missions & Systems. Earned 3 C.E.U.s.

c5bb8005-0725-4aa0-86bc-a92cb806f5b5.description: Earners have completed the 28-hour Model-Based Systems Engineering (MBSE) workshop focusing on the processes, practices, tools and techniques that comprise the emerging discipline of MBSE with emphasis on practical application. The course focuses on six central themes that comprise the advantages MBSE offers – Capturing, Connecting, Controlling, Communicating, Collaborating and Cycling – with specific examples including lessons learned from applications in NASA, DoD and commercial projects.
c5bb8005-0725-4aa0-86bc-a92cb806f5b5.name: Model-Based Systems Engineering

issuer.summary: issued by Teaching Science and Technology, Inc.

badge_template_activities.title: Successfully completed 28 contact hours of coursework in our Model-Based Systems Engineering workshop. Earned 3 C.E.U.s.

6e8ba2c0-e097-4071-8cbd-b65a7a403eb2.description: Earners have completed a 5-day, 26-hour Applied Project Management for Space Systems course. They can apply project management approaches to any phase of the space mission life cycle. They understand 5 linked processes for initiating, planning, executing, controlling and closing work to meet a set of requirements. They have tools and techniques for project definition, work breakdown, estimating, resource planning, critical path development, scheduling, project monitoring, and scope management.
6e8ba2c0-e097-4071-8cbd-b65a7a403eb2.name: Applied Project Management for Space Systems

issuer.summary: issued by Teaching Science and Technology, Inc.

badge_template_activities.title: Successfully completed 26 contact hours of coursework in Applied Project Management for Space Systems. Earned 3 C.E.U.s.

1782c0fb-35c9-4817-8d89-2a4b1b687c22.description: Earners understand the Foundations of Digital Engineering (DE) and are prepared to drive DE transformation. Earners apply principles of DE, including Model-Based Systems Engineering, Agile, and Open Architectures. They explore the challenges of maintaining an Authoritative Source of Truth in a dynamic enterprise environment. An understanding of digital environments and digital transformation metrics enables learners to apply these to define next steps for their organization.
1782c0fb-35c9-4817-8d89-2a4b1b687c22.name: Digital Engineering

issuer.summary: issued by Teaching Science and Technology, Inc.

badge_template_activities.title: Complete Digital Engineering course.

99fb34b0-af19-4778-8a01-4dea4fbd093f.description: After the 18-hour course, earners have an understanding of the Space Domain Cybersecurity Framework. They can define key threats and vulnerabilities that may affect space missions and systems and explain the impact on each layer of the space domain. Earners can apply cybersecurity first principles throughout the mission lifecycle and use these concepts to identify issues and potential mitigations. Earners can discuss NIST and other guidance, including the upcoming CMMC requirements.
99fb34b0-af19-4778-8a01-4dea4fbd093f.name: Space Domain Cybersecurity

issuer.summary: issued by Teaching Science and Technology, Inc.

badge_template_activities.title: Complete 18-hour Space Domain Cybersecurity course.

47693b5c-910c-42fc-b9a0-7864d2dcb8e3.description: Earners of the Human Spaceflight badge have completed coursework focusing on the conceptual framework for developing human space missions from concept to operations. After completing this advanced course, students can: summarize human spaceflight mission analysis and design principles; describe technical, physiological and physical capabilities and limitations; and apply principles with insight into the critical trade-offs between cost, schedule, performance and risk.
47693b5c-910c-42fc-b9a0-7864d2dcb8e3.name: Human Spaceflight

issuer.summary: issued by Teaching Science and Technology, Inc.

badge_template_activities.title: Successfully completed 26 contact hours of coursework in Human Spaceflight: Mission Analysis and Design. Earned 3 C.E.U.s.

2777a248-da93-4cd9-844a-c1e7963fd8f4.description: Earners have completed the 28-hour Mission Design workshop and have the knowledge, tools and experience to turn customer expectations in the form of an RFP or AO into a fully-defined mission concept, or critically analyze proposed mission concepts with insight into the critical trade-offs between cost, schedule, performance and risk.
2777a248-da93-4cd9-844a-c1e7963fd8f4.name: Mission Design Workshop

issuer.summary: issued by Teaching Science and Technology, Inc.

badge_template_activities.title: Successfully completed 28 contact hours of coursework in our Mission Design workshop. Earned 3 C.E.U.s.

edb94e69-3e53-4fd9-8070-f3d3d4959aa0.description: Earners can explain how systems engineering applies to verification and validation (V&V) planning and execution. Earners can describe the purpose and scope of key V&V documents as well as analyze representative verification plans, test sequences and activities for an example system. They can develop, evaluate and implement a master verification plan and use applicable standards and lessons learned to support system V&V decisions throughout the lifecycle.
edb94e69-3e53-4fd9-8070-f3d3d4959aa0.name: Space System Verification & Validation

issuer.summary: issued by Teaching Science and Technology, Inc.

badge_template_activities.title: Successfully completed 26 contact hours of coursework in our Space System Verification & Validation workshop. Earned 3 C.E.U.s.

88ad2ff4-b525-4ddc-8f12-c54b69503fd2.description: After completing the 18-hour Understanding Space introductory course, earners have a fundamental understanding of astronautics and space systems engineering. They can define important astronautics terms and concepts, comprehend space mission capabilities and limitations, and apply space concepts to real-world problems. They are also able to analyze typical space problems, synthesize concepts to design a space mission and evaluate basic technical and programmatic space issues.
88ad2ff4-b525-4ddc-8f12-c54b69503fd2.name: Understanding Space

issuer.summary: issued by Teaching Science and Technology, Inc.

badge_template_activities.title: Successfully completed 18 contact hours of coursework in our Understanding Space course. Earned 2 C.E.U.s.

84cf67c2-3ed2-412d-aa65-7c243984d14a.description: Earners have completed the 26-hour Designing Space Missions & Systems workshop which examines the real-world application of the entire space systems operations and engineering discipline. They have the knowledge, tools and experience to start with a blank sheet of paper and design an effective space mission to meet a broad set of objectives, or critically analyze proposed mission designs with insight into the critical trade-offs between cost, schedule, performance and risk.
84cf67c2-3ed2-412d-aa65-7c243984d14a.name: Certified Space Mission Designer

issuer.summary: issued by Teaching Science and Technology, Inc.

badge_template_activities.title: Successfully complete 5 day in-person or self-paced online Designing Space Missions & Systems course
Pass corresponding Designing Space Missions & Systems exam

c67fac7a-3846-4b55-a7c6-77caa80c4678.description: Earners can explain critical activities of space mission operations, develop and analyze mission ConOps documents and perform trade analyses to reduce mission ops complexity. Earners can apply principles of orbital mechanics to plan and implement operations activities and analyze key elements of mission ground systems. They can compare and contrast operations concepts for and develop planning, execution and support requirements for real-time space mission operations.
c67fac7a-3846-4b55-a7c6-77caa80c4678.name: Space Mission Operations

issuer.summary: issued by Teaching Science and Technology, Inc.

badge_template_activities.title: Successfully complete Space Mission Operations course.

3c9ecfa0-0b7c-4c69-923c-fa3c82ab049a.description: Earners of the Space in General Learning Path Badge, sponsored by the Saudi Space Commission, have completed a rigorous 4-course program requiring nearly 100 hours of class time. Upon completion, earners can explain key concepts in astronautics, apply principles of systems engineering to real-world problems as well as develop a credible business case for a potential commercial space mission that balances cost, schedule, performance and risk while maximizing return on investment for stakeholders.
3c9ecfa0-0b7c-4c69-923c-fa3c82ab049a.name: SSC Space in General Learning Path 2022

issuer.summary: issued by Teaching Science and Technology, Inc.

badge_template_activities.title: Understanding Space
Applied Space Systems Engineering
Business Engineering
Design Exercise

674e073a-23b3-47dd-8535-a6c8f88d5d59.description: Earners have completed the 4-day Applied Space Systems Engineering course.

issuer.summary: issued by Teaching Science and Technology, Inc.

badge_template_activities.title: Successfully completed 26 contact hours of coursework in Applied Space Systems Engineering. Earned 3 C.E.U.s.

9a1b75f8-3154-4cbd-8016-cdcd334f1cc5.description: Earners have completed a 30 hr Systems Engineering Advanced Training (SEAT) Program. The course examines systems engineering (SE) from a design, management and realization perspective with emphasis on practical applications of SE processes with hands-on applications. Earners work in small teams to develop a system model using model-based SE tools throughout the program.
9a1b75f8-3154-4cbd-8016-cdcd334f1cc5.name: Systems Engineering Advanced Training Program

issuer.summary: issued by Teaching Science and Technology, Inc.

badge_template_activities.title: Successfully completed 30 contact hours of coursework in Systems Engineering Advanced Training (SEAT) Program. Earned 3 C.E.U.s.
Passed SEAT exam.

153a11f7-b1f8-42de-8a6b-31a8ed51edda.description: Earners can explain critical activities of space mission operations, develop and analyze mission ConOps documents and perform trade analyses to reduce mission ops complexity. Earners can apply principles of orbital mechanics to plan and implement operations activities and analyze key elements of mission ground systems. They can compare and contrast operations concepts for and develop planning, execution and support requirements for real-time space mission operations.
153a11f7-b1f8-42de-8a6b-31a8ed51edda.name: Certified Space Operations Engineer

issuer.summary: issued by Teaching Science and Technology, Inc.

badge_template_activities.title: Successfully complete in-person or self-paced online Space Mission Operations course.
Pass corresponding Space Mission Operations exam.

5cbbe5ae-065d-46d1-812c-94e2254049c2.description: Earners will have completed an 8 hour Essential Model-Based Systems Engineering (MBSE) course focusing on big questions—What is MBSE? How will it improve my project products and processes? Why is it worth the investment? Earners will leave with the knowledge and background to more critically evaluate MBSE implementation in their organizations and with the foundation to pursue more advanced MBSE training.
5cbbe5ae-065d-46d1-812c-94e2254049c2.name: Essential Model-Based Systems Engineering

issuer.summary: issued by Teaching Science and Technology, Inc.

badge_template_activities.title: Successfully completed 8 contact hours of coursework in our Essential Model-Based Systems Engineering workshop.

8b4db0b4-a647-4513-8d38-cfcdf6a76d4b.description: Earners of the Technical Space Learning Path Badge, sponsored by the Saudi Space Commission, have completed a rigorous 4-course program requiring over 100 hours of class time. Earners can discuss and apply principles of space systems engineering across the entire mission lifecycle, including implementing system verification & validation plans, describing mission operations requirements & turning stakeholder requirements into a technical proposal that balances cost, schedule, performance & risk.
8b4db0b4-a647-4513-8d38-cfcdf6a76d4b.name: SSC Satellite Learning Path 2022

issuer.summary: issued by Teaching Science and Technology, Inc.

badge_template_activities.title: Designing Space Missions & Systems
Space System Verification and Validation
Space Mission Operations
Design Exercise

44ab2dce-e298-40b7-8cac-7c160bd926a8.description: Earners of the Certified Human Spaceflight Professional badge have demonstrated an understanding of the conceptual framework for developing human space missions from concept to operations. After completing this advanced course, students can: summarize human spaceflight mission analysis and design principles; describe technical, physiological and physical capabilities and limitations; and apply principles to develop and analyze solution architectures that balance mission objectives and risk.
44ab2dce-e298-40b7-8cac-7c160bd926a8.name: Certified Human Spaceflight Professional

issuer.summary: issued by Teaching Science and Technology, Inc.

badge_template_activities.title: Successfully complete three-to-five day in-person or self-paced online Human Spaceflight course
Pass corresponding Human Spaceflight exam.

9f4eb230-ac31-4688-bed0-c278520ba64c.description: Earners can explain the planning, analysis, organization, and integration of current and emerging operational and system capabilities to achieve desired mission effects. They can discuss and apply a top-down systems engineering approach to enhance current capabilities, integrate new technology, facilitate system interdependencies, and define architectures to guide the development of prototypes, experiments, and systems of systems to specific reference missions and to close overall mission gaps.
9f4eb230-ac31-4688-bed0-c278520ba64c.name: Mission Engineering

issuer.summary: issued by Teaching Science and Technology, Inc.

badge_template_activities.title: Complete 18-hour Mission Engineering course.

d0c01bb1-8315-4532-ab46-3f8bf6275d2d.description: Earners of the Certified Model-Based Systems Engineer (MBSE) badge have demonstrated a practical understanding of how to use models to practice systems engineering (SE). They can: develop and use SysML and other diagram types to capture, connect and communicate SE artifacts; use existing models to evaluate system behavior; produce and interpret documents, diagrams and SE artifacts to make project decisions; use tools to create new system model by applying design patterns and other heuristics.
d0c01bb1-8315-4532-ab46-3f8bf6275d2d.name: Certified Model-Based Systems Engineer

issuer.summary: issued by Teaching Science and Technology, Inc.

badge_template_activities.title: Successfully complete two- or three-day Model-Based Systems Engineering course
Pass corresponding Model-Based Systems Engineering exam
Submit Innoslate project showing ability at assess the current state of a project against baseline success criteria and recommend any necessary changes

7ac8ab60-fb71-429c-890d-61f58ed5b4a2.description: Earners can apply Systems Engineering tools and techniques to plan and implement a credible CubeSat Development Program. Starting with Pre-Phase A concept development and then progressing from Phase A to D, earners can describe and develop key artifacts needed to mature a cubesat mission through each major milestone. They have also practiced hands-on skills with simulated flight hardware to implement assembly, integration and verification procedures as well as on-orbit operations.
7ac8ab60-fb71-429c-890d-61f58ed5b4a2.name: Integrated CubeSat Engineering Workshop

issuer.summary: issued by Teaching Science and Technology, Inc.

badge_template_activities.title: Successfully completed 26 contact hours of coursework in our Integrated CubeSAT Engineering Workshop. Earned 3 C.E.U.s.

48e892b5-3af2-451f-a0e9-7ca1636a4bf1.description: Earners have completed the 26-hour Space Launch & Transportation Systems (SLaTS) workshop and can identify technical risk and mitigate it in the most cost-effective manner, while maintaining the technical integrity of the vehicle(s) and infrastructure. They have studied SLaTS design and operations, from customer objectives and requirements, through design, development, test and manufacturing to creating operations concepts and infrastructure capabilities while considering lifecycle costs.
48e892b5-3af2-451f-a0e9-7ca1636a4bf1.name: Space Launch & Transportation Systems

issuer.summary: issued by Teaching Science and Technology, Inc.

badge_template_activities.title: Successfully completed 26 contact hours of coursework in our Space Launch & Transportation Systems workshop. Earned 3 C.E.U.s.
